kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
Yes, this feature is not included in Xperience by Kentico today.
Xperience by Kentico is not a 1-for-1 replacement for Kentico Xperience 13. If you need this feature added natively to the product you can request it on [our public product roadmap](https://roadmap.kentico.com/tabs/6-next-refreshes). It helps us if you include the details of the business problem it would solve for you.
If you need this feature today, you can use something like [ILSpy for VS Code](https://github.com/icsharpcode/ilspy-vscode/wiki/Getting-started) to decompile our libraries and look at our default implementation.
Then, you can [replace](https://docs.kentico.com/x/xQSiCQ) the included [IEmailService](https://api-reference.kentico.com/api/CMS.EmailEngine.IEmailService.html) implementation with your own. You can also use a library like [Scrutor](https://github.com/khellang/Scrutor) to [decorate our interfaces](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v30.2.0.0/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/Configuration/ServiceCollectionMembershipExtensions.cs#L37) using ASP.NET Core features (instead of our dependency injection APIs).
